t: John 4
When*p therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,
(Though*p Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)
He*p left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.
And*p he must needs go through Samaria.
Then*p cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
Now*p Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well: and it was about the sixth hour.
There*p cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give*r me*r to*r drink.*r
(For*p his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)
Then*p saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

Jesus*p answered and said unto her, If*r thou*r knewest*r the*r gift*r of*r God,*r and*r who*r it*r is*r that*r saith*r to*r thee,*r Give*r me*r to*r drink;*r thou*r wouldest*r have*r asked*r of*r him,*r and*r he*r would*r have*r given*r thee*r living*r water.*r
The*p woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?
Art*p thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?
Jesus*p answered and said unto her, Whosoever*r drinketh*r of*r this*r water*r shall*r thirst*r again:*r

But*rp whosoever*r drinketh*r of*r the*r water*r that*r I*r shall*r give*r him*r shall*r never*r thirst;*r but*r the*r water*r that*r I*r shall*r give*r him*r shall*r be*r in*r him*r a*r well*r of*r water*r springing*r up*r into*r everlasting*r life.*r
The*p woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.
Jesus*p saith unto her, Go,*r call*r thy*r husband,*r and*r come*r hither.*r
The*p woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her, Thou*r hast*r well*r said,*r I*r have*r no*r husband:*r
For*rp thou*r hast*r had*r five*r husbands;*r and*r he*r whom*r thou*r now*r hast*r is*r not*r thy*r husband:*r in*r that*r saidst*r thou*r truly.*r
The*p woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
Our*p fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.
Jesus*p saith unto her, Woman,*r believe*r me,*r the*r hour*r cometh,*r when*r ye*r shall*r neither*r in*r this*r mountain,*r nor*r yet*r at*r Jerusalem,*r worship*r the*r Father.*r
Ye*rp worship*r ye*r know*r not*r what:*r we*r know*r what*r we*r worship:*r for*r salvation*r is*r of*r the*r Jews.*r

But*rp the*r hour*r cometh,*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r true*r worshippers*r shall*r worship*r the*r Father*r in*r spirit*r and*r in*r truth:*r for*r the*r Father*r seeketh*r such*r to*r worship*r him.*r
God*rp is*r a*r Spirit:*r and*r they*r that*r worship*r him*r must*r worship*r him*r in*r spirit*r and*r in*r truth.*r
The*p woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.
Jesus*p saith unto her, I*r that*r speak*r unto*r thee*r am*r he.*r
And*p upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?
The*p woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,
Come,*p see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?
Then*p they went out of the city, and came unto him.
In*p the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.
But*p he said unto them, I*r have*r meat*r to*r eat*r that*r ye*r know*r not*r of.*r
Therefore*p said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him ought to eat?
Jesus*p saith unto them, My*r meat*r is*r to*r do*r the*r will*r of*r him*r that*r sent*r me,*r and*r to*r finish*r his*r work.*r

Say*rp not*r ye,*r There*r are*r yet*r four*r months,*r and*r then*r cometh*r harvest?*r behold,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Lift*r up*r your*r eyes,*r and*r look*r on*r the*r fields;*r for*r they*r are*r white*r already*r to*r harvest.*r
And*rp he*r that*r reapeth*r receiveth*r wages,*r and*r gathereth*r fruit*r unto*r life*r eternal:*r that*r both*r he*r that*r soweth*r and*r he*r that*r reapeth*r may*r rejoice*r together.*r
And*rp herein*r is*r that*r saying*r true,*r One*r soweth,*r and*r another*r reapeth.*r
I*rp sent*r you*r to*r reap*r that*r whereon*r ye*r bestowed*r no*r labour:*r other*r men*r laboured,*r and*r ye*r are*r entered*r into*r their*r labours.*r
And*p many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.
So*p when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.
And*p many more believed because of his own word;
And*p said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard him ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.
Now*p after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.
For*p Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.
Then*p when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.
So*p Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.
When*p he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.
Then*p said Jesus unto him, Except*r ye*r see*r signs*r and*r wonders,*r ye*r will*r not*r believe.*r
The*p nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.
Jesus*p saith unto him, Go*r thy*r way;*r thy*r son*r liveth.*r And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.
And*p as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told him, saying, Thy son liveth.
Then*p enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.
So*p the father knew that it was at the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him, Thy*r son*r liveth:*r and himself believed, and his whole house.
This*p is again the second miracle that Jesus did, when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.
